Desc.eng: Van Helsing! I was hoping to meet you in person.
And how many soldiers are stationed at the command center?
Not too many. But as soon as they are under attack, they will alert the garrison nearby. That's when things will get complicated. You should deal with the garrison first.
A whole garrison? It sounds really reckless. We should definitely do this.
There is another way. You could inject poisonous gas through the air vents. That would take care of the soldiers. The vents have their own Force Walls.
So we could use the Demagnetizer?
No, they have their own generators. You will find them on the rooftops of the Bank of Borgova. One generator on the roof of each wing.
We have already taken care of those.
Thank you. We'll take over from here.
I like you, Van Helsing. Well then, you are free to go to the garrison rooftop and inject the poison into the vents.
Thank you. We'll take over from here.
I've heard a lot about you. You made a name for yourself as a spy. But where is Harker?

The General has holed up in a refurbished warehouse that they are using as a command center. And they are working on something mysterious. I saw cartloads of strange machines and carved slabs of stones.
I knew that he was hatching a plan! How can we approach the command center?
Only two bridges lead to the building, and both of them are the blocked by modified Force Walls. You need a special Demagnetizer Toolbox to disable them.
Our scientists must have one of those.
Demagnetizer? We found a strange device on a very unpleasant vampire. Is this the one?
No. There is only one person with a Demagnetizer on this side of the Force Walls. A vampire noble, a former ally of Vlados. He betrayed us and leads Harker's troops now.
Yes, it is. You can use it to pass through the Force Walls.
